meanings.definition: A small, powerful boat used for towing or pushing larger ships.
meanings.sent1: The tugboats guided the huge ship safely into the harbor.
meanings.sent2: The tugboats in the port were ready to assist any incoming vessels.
meanings.sent3: The tugboats played a crucial role in helping the stranded ship get back on course.
meanings.sent4: The tugboats were like loyal helpers, always there to support the larger ships.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tugboats chugging along the water stayed in his mind for days.

meanings.definition: To pull or drag with great effort or force, as a tugboat does with a ship.
meanings.sent1: He had to tugboats the heavy box up the stairs.
meanings.sent2: She tugboats the stubborn donkey along the path.
meanings.sent3: The child tried to tugboats the kite out of the tree with all his might.
meanings.sent4: The old car struggled to move forward, as if trying to tugboats itself along.
meanings.sent5: The memory tugged at her heart like a tugboats pulling a ship through rough waters.
